name: BBCWorld
text:
Around the world scientists are working to find treatments for coronavirus

There are a number of studies underway and some progress has been made 

So, how close are we to finding a treatment? 

[Thread]

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text:
150+ drugs are being researched worldwide:

üíâ WHO running the ‚ÄòSolidarity trial‚Äô to assess most promising treatments
üíâUK has 11,000+ patients in a Recovery trial
üíâScientists around the world are looking at using survivors' blood as a treatment ü©∏ 

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text:
There are 3 types of drug being tested:
üíä Antiviral (directly attack coronavirus inside the body)
üíä Drugs which prevent patients‚Äô immune system over-reacting & harming the body
üíä Antibodies, from survivors' blood / made in a lab, which attack the virus

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text:
Some drugs seem promising for treating the virus:

üíä Dexamethasone - the steroid may cut the risk of death for patients on ventilators or on oxygen
üíä Remdesivir - the antiviral can cut the duration of symptoms from 15 to 11 days 

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text:
Antibodies are the bodies way of attacking viruses

People who survive infection should have antibodies in their blood that can attack the virus

Scientists are looking at ways to use survivors blood ü©∏ to help sick patients  

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text: We don't know when we might have a drug to treat coronavirus but results of trials should come in the next few mont‚Ä¶ https://t.co/6SOnjpKWQo

name: BBCWorld
text:
Around the world scientists are working to find treatments for coronavirus

There are a number of studies underway, and some progress has been made 

So, how close are we to finding a treatment? 

[Thread]

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa

name: BBCWorld
text:
150+ drugs are being researched worldwide:

üíâ WHO is running the ‚ÄòSolidarity trial‚Äô to assess most promising treatments
üíâUK has 11,000+ patients in a Recovery trial
üíâScientists around the world are looking to use survivors' blood as a treatment ü©∏ 

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa https://t.co/RpbFXmcHQn

name: BBCWorld
text:
There are 3 types of drug being tested:
üíä Antivirals which directly attack coronavirus inside the body
üíä Drugs which prevent the immune system over-reacting & harming the body
üíä Antibodies, from survivors' blood or made in a lab, that attack the virus

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa https://t.co/xu3gY047BU

name: BBCWorld
text:
Some drugs seem promising for treating the virus:

üíä Dexamethasone - the steroid may cut the risk of death for patients on ventilators or on oxygen
üíä Remdesivir - the antiviral can cut the duration of symptoms from 15 to 11 days 

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa https://t.co/VUmCn35GCN

name: BBCWorld
text:
Antibodies are the body's way of attacking viruses

People who survive infection should have antibodies in their blood that can attack coronavirus

Scientists are looking at ways to use survivors' blood ü©∏ to help the most ill patients 

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa https://t.co/o2QFwQmWa8

name: BBCWorld
text:
We don't know when we might have a drug to treat coronavirus, but results of trials should come in the next few months 

A vaccine will likely take longer as it will have to be developed from scratch, rather than repurposing drugs already deemed safe

https://t.co/OUdBNZ3pfa https://t.co/l1HSJRUqtq
